column4: hi! i'm updating my home server to ubuntu 8.10 (desktop) and i'm having some problems with my network card. it's an old SFF compaq with integrated NIC that worked perfectly fine in my previous installation (i think it was ubuntu 7.04) and even after first boot with new system. however now i have to issue a manual start for this interface (that's not good, my parents can't handle linux and it's our home gateway). Pastes: dmesg (filtered f
you can add the module to /etc/modules
not sure the drive name
according to dmesg it should be this one
add that
ok, be back soon, have to restart
i didn't help. this interface didn't start, even though the module is now loaded (without manually settig iface up)
janisozaur:
hmm
how would you start the interface now to make it work>
ifconfig eth0 up 192.168.0.1 netmask 255.255.255.0
add it to /etc/rc.local
/etc/network/interfaces contains entry that should start it
and it will do it at boot
when does this script execute? i have a firewall and dhcpd depending on that interface, so i would like it to start prior to them
that is your system startup script
put any special commands in there and it will be executed at boot
i know, but will it start before or after /etc/rc0.d/K89shorewall and /etc/rc1.d/K40dhcp3-server ?
Not sure, I think after. You can always tell /etc/rc.local to turn on service instead of the standard way
are rcX.d files ran in alphabetical order? if so i could put a symlink there, because starting firewall is a bit lenghty process
Ubuntu has a funky way of managing services, disable it with the GUI and tel /etc/rc.local to turn it on
X wil stil load before /etc/rc.local is done
weird, this service manager says that shorewall firewall is already turned off. Could it be because it's not running currently?
